forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
Thanks for the suggestion, are you the author?  

I understand it can be used to read the chips from USB drives, but would you enlighten me on the situations where it is used?

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
Thanks for the link.  

Now I see that it can be used to fetch the drivers to make USB work.  

![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Now I ***see*** that it can be used to fetch the drivers to make USB work.
Well, I can recommend you to a good optician. ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)   

In 2K/XP/2003 the USB Mass Storage Drivers are included in the OS, and ANY stick is supported by them.  

The tool is helpful in finding the Chip Manufacturer's "tools" which in some cases allow for nice tricks, like flipping at will the "Removable/Fixed" bit, creating a CD-ROM device on the stick, creating read only devices, etc.  

Beware, NOT for the faint of heart, NOT for the newbie:  
*KIDS, DON'T DO THIS AT HOME*   

jaclaz

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
> In 2K/XP/2003 the USB Mass Storage Drivers are included in the OS, and ANY stick is supported by them.

Yes, I was actually remembering the recent case of Windows 98 (non-SE) where the USB support was a bit more complicated.  

In case I do stumble on some non-supported drive then perhaps I'm lucky enough to find the driver on the manufacturer's page.  

![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Yes, I was actually remembering the recent case of Windows 98 (non-SE) where the USB support was a bit more complicated.

Didn't this:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=2411](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=2411 "External link")  

work? ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)  

NUSB should work on FE as well, since a lonfg time:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...a...html\&st=361](http://www.msfn.org/board/Maximum-Decim-Native-USB-t43605.html&st=361 "External link")  

You can get both FE and SE versions here:  
[http://www.technical...kb/usbmsd98.php](http://www.technical-assistance.co.uk/kb/usbmsd98.php "External link")  
[http://www.technical...age-drivers.php](http://www.technical-assistance.co.uk/kb/win98fe-usb-mass-storage-drivers.php "External link")  
[http://www.technical...age-drivers.php](http://www.technical-assistance.co.uk/kb/win98se-usb-mass-storage-drivers.php "External link")  

Or was it a problem with a non-English version? ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)  

jaclaz
